name: viburnum bodnantense
description: The name Viburnum × bodnantense, the Bodnant viburnum, is used for a group of hybrid flowering plant cultivars of garden origin.

name: parrotia persica
description: Parrotia persica (commonly called Persian ironwood) is a deciduous tree in the family Hamamelidaceae, closely related to the witch-hazel genus Hamamelis.

name: sarcococca confusa
description: Sarcococca confusa, the sweet box, is a species of flowering plant in the family Buxaceae, probably native to western China.

name: abeliophyllum distichum
description: Abeliophyllum, the miseonnamu, Korean abeliophyllum, white forsythia, or Korean abelialeaf, is a monotypic genus of flowering plants in the olive family, Oleaceae.

name: crocus tommasinianus
description: Crocus tommasinianus, the woodland crocus, early crocus, or Tommasini's crocus, often referred to as 'tommies'

name: prunus persica
description: The peach (Prunus persica) is a deciduous tree native to the region of Northwest China between the Tarim Basin and the north slopes of the Kunlun Mountains, where it was first domesticated and cultivated.

name: prunus amygdalus
description: The almond (Prunus dulcis, syn. Prunus amygdalus) is a species of tree native to Iran and surrounding countries as well as Central Asia, but widely cultivated elsewhere

name: prunus cerasifera
description: Prunus cerasifera is a species of plum known by the common names cherry plum and myrobalan plum.

name: choisya ternata
description: Choisya is a small genus of aromatic evergreen shrubs in the rue family, Rutaceae. Members of the genus are commonly known as Mexican orange due to the similarity of their flowers with those of the closely related orange, both in shape and scent.

name: corylus colurna
description: Corylus colurna, the Turkish hazel or Turkish filbert, is a deciduous tree native to southeast Europe and southwest Asia, from the Balkans through northern Turkey to northern Iran.

name: crocus chrysanthus
description: Crocus chrysanthus (snow crocus, golden crocus) is a species of flowering plant of the Crocus genus in the family Iridaceae. Native to the Balkans and Turkey, it bears vivid orange-yellow bowl-shaped flowers.

name: helleborus niger
description: Helleborus niger, commonly called Christmas rose or black hellebore, is an evergreen perennial flowering plant in the buttercup family, Ranunculaceae. It is poisonous.

name: bellis perennis
description: Bellis perennis is a common European species of daisy, of the Asteraceae family, often considered the archetypal species of that name.

name: corylus avellana
description: Corylus avellana, the common hazel, is a species of hazel native to Europe and western Asia, from the British Isles south to Iberia, Greece, Turkey and Cyprus, north to central Scandinavia, and east to the central Ural Mountains, the Caucasus, and northwestern Iran.

name: eranthis hyemalis
description: Eranthis hyemalis is a species of flowering plant in the buttercup family Ranunculaceae, native to calcareous woodland habitats in France, Italy and the Balkans and widely naturalised elsewhere in Europe.

name: crocus vernus
description: Crocus vernus (Spring Crocus, Giant Crocus) is a species in Family Iridaceae, native to the Alps, the Pyrenees, and the Balkans

name: capsella bursa-pastoris
description: Capsella bursa-pastoris, known by its common name shepherd's purse because of its triangular flat fruits.

name: salix caprea
description: Salix caprea (goat willow, also known as the pussy willow or great sallow) is a common species of willow native to Europe and western and central Asia.

name: Cercis siliquastrum
description: Cercis siliquastrum, commonly known as the Judas tree or Judas-tree, is a small deciduous tree from Southern Europe and Western Asia which is noted for its prolific display of deep pink flowers in spring.

name: senecio vulgaris
description: Senecio vulgaris, often known by the common names groundsel and old-man-in-the-Spring,[4] is a flowering plant in the daisy family Asteraceae.

name: erica darleyensis
description: Erica × darleyensis (unresolved), the Darley Dale heath, is a plant hybrid between the heathers E. carnea and E. erigena, probably of garden origin.

name: galanthus nivalis
description: Galanthus nivalis, the snowdrop or common snowdrop, is the best-known and most widespread of the 20 species in its genus, Galanthus.

name: petasites hybridus
description: Petasites hybridus, the butterbur, is a herbaceous perennial flowering plant in the daisy family Asteraceae, native to Europe and northern Asia.

name: elaeagnus umbellata
description: Elaeagnus, silverberry or oleaster, is a genus of about 50–70 species of flowering plants in the family Elaeagnaceae.

name: scilla bifolia
description: Scilla bifolia (alpine squill or two-leaf squill) is a herbaceous perennial growing from an underground bulb, belonging to the genus Scilla of the Asparagaceae family.

name: helleborus foetidus
description: Helleborus foetidus, known variously as stinking hellebore, dungwort, setterwort and bear's foot, is a species of flowering plant in the buttercup family Ranunculaceae, native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe, Greece and Asia Minor.

name: prunus spinosa
description: Prunus spinosa, called blackthorn or sloe, is a species of flowering plant in the rose family Rosaceae. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and locally in northwest Africa.

name: caltha palustris
description: Caltha palustris, known as marsh-marigold and kingcup, is a small to medium size perennial herbaceous plant of the buttercup family, native to marshes, fens, ditches and wet woodland in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.

name: cornus mas
description: Cornus mas (Cornelian cherry, European cornel or Cornelian cherry dogwood) is a species of flowering plant in the dogwood family Cornaceae native to Southern Europe and Southwestern Asia.

name: pachysandra terminalis
description: Pachysandra terminalis, the Japanese pachysandra, carpet box or Japanese spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the boxwood family Buxaceae, native to Japan, Korea and China.

name: ficaria verna
description: Ficaria verna, (formerly Ranunculus ficaria L.) commonly known as lesser celandine or pilewort,[3] is a low-growing, hairless perennial flowering plant in the buttercup family Ranunculaceae native to Europe and west Asia.
